column4: Hi, I have dual monitors set up. My second monitor is a 30" TV capable of 1920x1080. It's hooked up through a DVI port. The DVI input is on the TV and the HDMI is on my laptop, so I'm using an HDMI to DVI cable. I'm using the proprietary nvidia drivers. In Windows, I can do a resolution of 1920x1080 on it, but in Ubuntu I can only do a resolution of 1360x768. Does anyone have an idea why?
you probably have to set the Resolution manually
i have been having issues with that too. -
oh- i dont beleive in paying for things..
most of it never works..
do you know how I would go about doing that?
If it works, and i like it. I donate. I like that method.
uh- kinda..
not well enough to walk you through it.
Its kinda easy, just annoying
For me, i would open/create a xorg.conf file..
is it in a config file or something? I've been using Ubuntu for about a year. If you give me a general idea of how, I could probably figure it out
i have to create one for my setup, which is where my ATI is annoying.
i have been using int a lot longer, i just dont stick with it enough because it tickes me off too much. In your /etc/X11/ should be a xorg.conf edit it.
okay
In there you'll see a section.. Problem is- im use to ati,
let me see what mines even says. i disconnected the monitor.
anyone got something for Network Traffic MOnitor - i just wanna see the KB/s
Ya, mines all f;ed up- i cant use it to compare.
I was havinig a lot of issues with Kubuntu confusing which monitor was primpary.. ugh
either way, ur going to have a Screen0 and Screen1 i suppose. if it is already filled it, you can just edit the resolution yourself.
